fzV-MKKsahharGdOj8vkSA.text: I love this restaurant! Very good food and service. The gnocchi and short ribs are amazing! The crab cakes are to die for! The vibe of the restaurant is very nice, and they have a great bar. They have some yummy cocktails too. The butterscotch-pecan pie is so good. They serve brunch on Saturday and Sunday with a Bloody Mary and Bellini bar. I highly recommend Twisted Gove!

rVBcOWaEst39Jlv0IUOKhQ.text: I was meeting family visiting from out of town and wanted to find a place close to where they were staying so I entered their zip code and Twisted Grove was featured. I read a number of reviews and decided to meet there. The building is spacious and very warm.  Large booths and the staff was very friendly.  We started off with their build your own bloody mary. Several different types of olives to choose from and other items but had I tasted the bacon before I went back to the booth I would have cleaned out the jar.  It was amazing.  We asked the waitress her suggestions so she named several but when she said Crab Cakes she didn't need to say another word. All 4 of us ordered the crab cakes.  It's not lumb crab it's more shredded but it's all crab with just a little binding and a light coating. My cousin who is from NY said it was the best he's ever had. We were there visiting for two hours and never once did we feel rushed. If we are ever back in that neck of the woods we will definitely go back.

76VRIHzQY9w0XDQuMgxDOw.text: Twisted noodle salad is the Best salad I've EVER had! The  Angry Bird flatbread was also delish! Quick and good service and their own cute sweet shop next door! LOVE everything about this place!

qWmzBdqAFkDF3_KLBpn1rg.text: I'm not normally one to leave reviews, but this was one of the better restaurants I've ever tried in Scottsdale. After reading the reviews I tried the Brussel sprouts, and while I'm usually not a fan I have to say that I did enjoy these. Overall a great experience and our waitress Juliet was very good at taking care of us. Excited to come back next time I'm in Scottsdale!

n_x_M6cXIZo42V1Qati6Hg.text: My wife and I just checked out this local spot and were really impressed, the food and service were amazing.  The staff was very friendly, inviting, and everyone had a smile on their face.  Both of our dishes were unique and  quite good.  Just a great all around dinner experience.  Can't wait to come back!

vxYnF3hVgcoEOZsbLOwFrQ.text: absolutely amazing! do yourselves a favor and go to twisted grove now! we started with a bruschetta assortment, and then moved onto the cavatelli, short ribs, and twisted noodle salad.   you know an establishment takes pride in their food when the presentation grabs your eye. bright colors, perfectly cooked beef, fresh pasta, fresh gnocchi, house made bacon, the works. pro tip...get the sunny side up egg on the cavatelli.  we finished the meal with the cookies (fresh baked) and chocolate milk (some concoction of chocolate yummyness). you have to get this! pro tip...don't let your 2.5 year old get a hold of the milk. it was gone in a matter of seconds  we had a fantastic server which made the meal even more enjoyable.   note...they have an extensive beer and wine list which I appreciated.   another note...they have a solid kids menu, but it's not printed. the server will list it off for you. we got the Mac n cheese, French fries, and veggies. it's served on a plate with separate compartments which is perfect for the kiddos.  can't wait to go back!

quVv-6kly3UvBtPi8QLs7Q.text: My kids live their brunch waffles and I love their grilled chicken sandwich.   Great environment with cozy booths.   One of my favorites

CgkUzf6S3eEs5dYN4sS-aA.text: Finally a new restaurant that has good food! Great service, best martini I've ever had, food was on point. Just wish we lived closer.

aiRZMIVVIlXjL_JEigYYuQ.text: The Brussels Sprouts w/Bacon & Balsamic-- DELICIOUS! The crab cakes (all lump, very little filler) were yummy ! Pasta dish-- Gold Star and the Sea Bass was solid  Super friendly wait staff. Great experience visiting Scottsdale from San Francisco Bay Area.

Dz4H0_a0KfRbEcDFAKfPsQ.text: went to lunch here last weekend.... I saw the high reviews and was expecting great food and service. The food was okay not bad... We sat at the bar, ordered 2 cocktails and the bartender didn't know how to make them, We saw her reading the menu to see what was in them. we were kinda disappointed.

Yv0DUQrT6QplTPuEOhOTqw.text: OMG - best place ever!!! Service at the bar was wonderful, as Joseph was our bartender.  He was attentive and very helpful when he found out this was our first time here. He helped us during happy hour and pointed out the specials and great food values.  Tried the brussels sprouts and they were great - bacon makes everything better and the balsamic reduction was awesome. Ventured onto the short rib gnocchi and thought we had died and gone to heaven!  Tried the oysters, they were the large variety and nothing to brag about.... Joseph the bartender definitely helped elevate our experience - also try the fish tacos at happy hour - in house made pickled onions on them - sounds weird but delicious!!!

CE0CLuKHvBqndPl4aSbB3Q.text: Love the ambiance here and the service has always been gray.  They have Happy Hour 3-6 in the entire restaurant and not just the bar, which I love.  Initially gave this place four stars but updating to a five since I have tried a few new things.  Prime rib sliders are amazing (this coming from someone who normally won't touch prime rib), as is the Angry Bird Flatbread and the crab cakes.  I didn't think the bruschetta or mushroom pasta was anything to write home about.   As for drinks, the Fleur de Lis has become my favorite drink in town.  The Paloma was good (fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, but could not taste any alcohol).  The Collins tasted like vodka soda with a splash of lemon if you like that kind of thing (I prefer a little more fruit flavor).

N4LN-9gns74xikZNCIuWyA.text: Wonderful Happy Hour 7 days a week. Prime rib sliders, spinach dip, and fish tacos were exceptional. Atmosphere is beautiful. Drinks are clever. Paid $30 for dinner and drinks for two. Very pleased. I would have given it 5 stars if our server had been a bit more experienced. She was very sweet though. I ordered 2 raw oysters but sent them back because they were too small. They were $2.50 a piece. So I guess they were worth the price. We got a gift certificate for a free scoop of ice cream at the store down the block. Every table got this. I think it was called Sweet P's? Great ice cream. What a nice touch to end the meal.

5HLJ1iko4OgOmMujO_prWw.text: Great menu / food! Ordered the tri tip sandwich and loved it. It comes with amazing french fries but next time Im going to see if I can do a side salad instead. The restaurant is a lot bigger than anticipated and the patio is super cute! Highly recommend this place. Wish I would have found it sooner.

uEQGTr1u_ivVLUAfY7E0yA.text: Great restaurant for the neighborhood.    Great atmosphere and a perfect place for all ages.  Nice patio and inside is very spacious.  Had the tri tip sandwich.  Was a little small but that's alright bc most places serve too much.   We will be back when we are on that side of town.

P7KTd9eXt2qdigIDUTzhlQ.text: If they had 6, i would give it.  Wow on crab cakes, gnocchi, short rib, sliders and tres leches.   Service was super great!  This will b a regular visit anytime we r in scottsdale.

F6WD3ho7uYEcuiLOB32ZrA.text: The food was good, but far too expensive based on service. After the young lady took my order, the food arrived quickly, however she never came back to the table to ask how things were, refill water, etc. I will not be returning here any time soon.

yP4K_ll0VBH6wQ4wNLZYcQ.text: I have been here about 5 times only for happy hour until tonight. Great wine list and happy hour. Tonight I had their crab cakes which were excellent! The noodle salad was amazing. I love all.the flavors they put in their food. My favorite place right now.

eUizunqAi5DLm9ARq9Et7g.text: From the start the atmosphere was soft and inviting.  Service was friendly and engaging. The grouper sandwich pleasant take on a classic fish sandwich with plenty of flavor.

6Ojr8xhzGMbFPGRnnHOzAQ.text: This was a great place for a work lunch! The atmosphere was casual and fun and it wasn't overly crowded. The service was amazing and fast. The crispy grouper sandwich was delicious! The coleslaw is a little strong so be aware if you don't like that. Overall it was really enjoyable.

IMwLsndvY2ZbfxVpIpPyhA.text: We had our company holiday party here at Twisted Grove and it could not have been better! The entire process went so smooth and the staff was very accommodating. The prices for a semi large party were very reasonable as well. I would highly recommend hosting an event with this awesome restaurant, we will definitely be back!

eQOaZsaFRI8YnaMKESdQ6w.text: So far so awesome!  Friendly, professional staff.....great drinks.....really good food, love the menu........busy which is a sign unlike many other places lol.  Although there are many places that are busy simply because of the reputation and they don't deserve to be...especially because of the cost.  I AM the food original snob from Chicago........I HAVE owned AND operated restaurants, catering, banquets and a wedding coordinator, so please.....trust me!  Fun place with food and service worth every penny.

xA3IinZJiuuL_qGF4YbK1g.text: Good customer service, fast, and wonderful delicious food ! We ordered the charred Brussels sprouts appetizer and for entree : twisted noodle salad, gnocchi and short ribs and cavatelli carbonara... that was one of the best meals each one in our table had!  For dessert tres leches cake! Yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Good wine as well

IinkmVbIBhd9NUrsyWczdw.text: Incredible place! We hosted our company Christmas party on the back patio and could not have been more impressed. The entire experience from reserving the space to coordinating with Maya on the menu to the service we received from Ron was top notch. Would definitely have it again there in future years!

N7iZKlvEwv_eKUqtWbVk9A.text: I organized a company banquet at Twisted Grove on a company visit to Phoenix, and they did a wonderful job of hosting the ~20 of us. The food was great, served well, and the patio was a great place to dine. Setup of the event was extremely smooth, with the staff making sure that we would have the best event possible. I will visit again next time I'm in Phoenix!

Eqo7jUagI17qO1p7PZfo4A.text: Went with a girlfriend for lunch - originally had planned to go to their sister restaurant in the same shopping area but it was packed. Thought we'd try this.  SO glad we did. I loved the options on the menu, my friend had been before and said that she'd had the crabcakes and they were supper yummy. This time she had a salad and I had the angry chicken flat bread. We were both quite happy with our meal!  The staff is friendly and great about coming back and refilling the water/soda. I definitely plan on going back again when I have a little more time. So many yummy sounding things on the menu!!

FkwykFZA7p-NpDzqkneCjA.text: Had some amazing bruschetta.  The brussels sprouts were flavorful and well cooked.  They were very browned and well seasoned.  The Happy hour is really great as well with specials that are good prices for drinks.  I had picnic chicken on one of my visits it was fabulous.  I would like to come back again and try some more of the menu items.

5rMGbm4uiwbSufJedM-YAA.text: Enjoyed bar and quiet time with hubby. He is the most picky water ever and he liked it. Whew!!

MHu6vCmv1heM0LN1AzzSjw.text: Not the happy hour it should be. I've had Arby's sandwiches that tasted better than this place's "prime rib" sliders. The bruschetta is bland and doesn't compare to Postinos. Their picnic chicken is dry nor crispy. This place does give me hope however, that I could open my own restaurant and get away with over charging sub par food. The two stars are for the atmosphere and well made adult beverage.

DVgJHeSmhSKqimvqw6REUA.text: Twisted Grove is literally around the corner from me, and I find myself here for dinner solo at least a few times a month. Somehow being alone in a busy restaurant with good food gives me the reflection-time I crave after especially stressful days at work.    If you're lucky enough to get there in time for happy hour, spoil yourself with the oysters! You won't be disappointed. They are fresh and shucked right in front of you. It is not the weird Arizona--seafood?? feeling that I find sometimes at other establishments, these are fresh and delicious and make me happy when I can get there in time.   I vary between the crab cake and salmon with Cesar salad, though I've experimented with most items on the menu. It is just an easy feel-good salad, order the small and you'll be satisfied without being overly stuffed. Again, these options are fresh and delicious seafood options, you can taste the quality in the first bite.   My favorite bartender is Stacey, she is super sweet.  She is the perfect bartender who knows how to chat while still taking cues if I'm not quite in the mood or busy flipping through work emails.   The cocktails are wonderful, the crowd is always happy, and the service is always spot-on. I'm so lucky to live nearby!

op2hRLymTHyz4GBw-uf05Q.text: After a long week of work the hubs and I decided we needed something delicious in our bellies that didn't require us to cook after a long week of unpacking and work....soooo we came here!!   We had a 40 minute wait for a table and it was worth every minute. The staff was pleasant, the bartenders looked like they had some good banter going on with their patrons and oh the feeling and ambiance of this restaurant is so enthralling, timeless and so so welcoming.   The hubs and I decided to get a few small plates {**ORDER THE BRUSSLE SPROUTS**} and one entree to share...oh and wine and an old fashioned.   You guys...it was all so delicious, the flavors paired so nicely between the three plates we ordered ... And then the dessert!!! Ah just go and have an amazing meal at an amazing restaurant and just know you will leave extremely satisfied.

nsl724kTigudfNrrfL4wPA.text: Ordered the twisted noodle salad to go and when I got home both salads were missing the noodle... this is the second time they have messed up our order.

P15xeswXylr2QrMsvKd4UA.text: This place is just OK. Food is really not special and service felt forced.  Hostess couldn't smile, and server help rolled her eyes as she tried to set the wrong order in front of my wife. Later, another server tried to bring us someone else's order. My salmon was sub par, not much flavor. Just another chain. Kind of pricey too.

MoTP6PA6Nt8WJQ7fKyY4YA.text: Food was excellent, service was very good - we had a group in the Board Room so it was fun being in our own area (with a patio).

YCd1nIlBOXMH45J6d8YcNQ.text: Great food, nice service. Love that kids eat free during happy hour and get free scoops of ice cream next door!

NmBUNozbmTXKlRkQWwc30A.text: The atmosphere was great and we had a wonderful meal! The salmon + wonder salad was delicious and we highly recommend the chicken. To top is off Juliette our server was so personable and attentive! We will be back!

ryKJ97RRFwfBk8B8jUkVFA.text: The short rib gnocchi was fantastic. It was a slice of heaven. This family of restaurants do not disappoint. The customer service is awesome. They love out of town guests. Ask for Tristyn at the bar. She will guide you to beat items.

7IEi3bQq4LMYh15v_941UQ.text: Amazing service. Corey the bartender was great remembered our names and greeted us. Cocktails were fantastic and so was the food. 10/10 will be back and recommending to friends.

H5mt-h4nolNxIHy6DdD6TA.text: A bit overpriced, but a fun atmosphere! Our waiter was super awkward, bless his heart, but he and the rest of the staff were kind. I ordered the Brussels sprouts, which were tasty but a bit undercooked and extremely salty. Loved the pieces of bacon mixed in. I had the club sandwich and my husband had the prosciutto flatbread. My sandwich was good and the flatbread was also good, although a bit bland. The fries were really good, and I usually don't eat fries when they come with my meal.  There are a few other items on the menu I would like to come back and try, and they also have a brunch menu that has some fun breakfast dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6IVno5h7eL4QykRlQEOdTw.text: I came here to dinner with my friend. It was during the week, so it wasn't too busy and the wait wasn't too long for a table either.   I ordered the gnocchi and short ribs. The short ribs were so tender and the sauce was very good. I thought the entree was very filling though and my friend felt the same way about hers.   They also have really good cocktails here and the service was really good. They have a brunch menu as well as happy hour. I'd come back to try some other items!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi and spare ribs

3wcH2g5Rt7sHhwBrlPnuwg.text: Wow, OMG, unbelievably awesome.  I would give them 10 stars if there were room for it.  This place is a hidden gem. Our crew of eight rolled in  for Sunday brunch.   No line, no waiting just friendly service. Our server Tristyn was super.   The kids had some awesome breakfast meal with ice cream soaked French toast. Doesn't that just sound like heaven.  I had the cowboy hash. I didn't know breakfast could be this good.  Refills on fresh orange juice and lemonade. We even got a card for a free scoop of ice cream at Sweet provisions.  Hands-down one of my top five breakfast ever!  As if the great food and service weren't enough, I turn my head and what did I see, Notorious B.I.G. on the wall paper. Mind blown

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cowboy hash
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Notorious B.I.G. wallpaper. Got to get some for the house.

cr-F3iYdleybTV62ejFIyw.text: After eating at Grassroots Kitchen and Tap I knew we had to try this place.  The food didn't disappoint.  It was a wonderful experience.  The servers are very knowledgeable in describing all the offerings.  They have great happy hour offerings.  The conversation level is high which makes communication challenging.  You must try both locations of this very talented chef.

_7dKnXuqg8qy7VmKBaMfmg.text: What a wonderful time we had tonight for dinner with our group in the boardroom. Our waitress was Danielle and she is awesome! We had probably 40 people and she was the greeter, took our orders and server and anything else we needed!  I had a vegetarian vegetable plate that was very tasty.  My husband enjoyed his chicken.   If you ever come to this restaurant be sure to ask for Danielle!

aIASSCXSwrNBGbzUg65ftg.text: I'm just going to say...go on Friday for the LOBSTER ROLL! So GOOD!  I first tried the coleslaw because you know a place has good food when the coleslaw is the bomb, their coleslaw is the BOMB!!! The lobster roll lives up to the coleslaw and the fries are awesome too.  There are so many yummy options I want to go back and try them all.  I also had the blueberry smash cocktail and it was also awesome!  It was refreshing with just the right amount of sweet.  I could easily knock a few of those out enjoying some time on the patio! If it's for a drink or the lobster roll GO!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eUo3TjpMi9GHEVzn0tlb5w.text: Long wait,  Loud and Noisy .. They also need to do some housekeeping.. waited close to an hour for a table...was never seated...ended up Leaving

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spider Webs all over waiting area!

p4aJVNsLxYUDYlL1fx6gdA.text: This is a solid place, I don't come as often as I should because I can't skip their sister restaurant just across the parking lot. I love the  Brussels sprouts, a must have every time.  The shishito peppers are also great. I had the eggplant stack last time and it was very good.  I ordered an off the menu cocktail (a Negroni) and it was ok, not the traditional way but it was ok. My friend had the grouper sandwich with the butternut squash and she liked it.

lZhDgDrbOw_QAFgREKzCOg.text: This was hands down the best lunch I've had in AZ. The food is amazing and the drinks are great! We tried the strawberry Bellini, blueberry smash, and the fleur de lis I would highly recommend the last - it was our favorite. I got the chose three bruschetta which was simply to die for - if you like bacon you have to get the candied bacon one because let me tell you that bacon is  I also got the avocado and the buretta with tomato jam which were both very tasty. My husband got the salmon which was cooked to perfection - the brocolini was over cooked.  Make sure to have a reservation if you don't want to sit at a community table or the bar - despite the open tables those are your options if you don't make one.

95Dt3GrPUuava_kFJruU5A.text: 10 out of 5 stars!  First, we were walking out of Grass Roots disappointed at the wait. Richard happened to come along and inquire, grabbed his phone and called Twisted Grove. Next thing you know we had a table. Richard only said that he is associated with both. Our luck for sure. Twisted Grove was amazing!  From appetizers to drinks and food, it did not disappoint!  Nani was the best server ever! Bruschetta board is a must!  Nani is the best server ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Most of the menu.
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta board. A must try!

2XPpHuCPJmZg-hA5V8cW8g.text: OMG!! This place is amazing, when you walk in first of all is just absolutely updated modern so nice, I really love the decor the Ambiance and the atmosphere.  To begin with I had ordered the blueberry smash which is a awesome drink made with the imported Hawaiian koloa rum which is absolutely amazing. Then we ordered appetizers for our first appetizer we ordered the charred brussel sprouts just the presentation alone was absolutely beautiful to the eye. Then we also ordered the bruschetta board which comes with a variety of different choices and you get to pick 3 out of the many choices that they have to offer, my three choices where the Jammin spicy tomato, the goat cheese, and the candy pecans. Talk about amazing and delicious to the taste buds I was fully fully impressed with this place, I will definitely be back here again.

YwKfKMAsWzdGFF4MrZh_wg.text: Great service and the food is always good. Definitely get the Brussel Spouts Appetizer!

1yd2sklmHhQEuKwNuMxozw.text: Met up with the girls here. The roasted Brussel sprouts were amazing.  And the spinach dip was really really good. Overall i really enjoyed. I also had crab cakes but they were pretty normal.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rotisserie chicken

Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oreo cheese cake.

m8KWaA0k4U7MEgSXMiaaVw.text: Great little gem in McCormick ranch area that serves American food. My boyfriend and I went for happy hour on his birthday weekend and definitely glad we did! We were greeted by Erica at the bar who took our drink/food order. We got the prime rib slider (1) for $4 and fish tacos (2) for $7. My bf got a 16 oz beer for $4...you can't beat that! Tristan was also super sweet and got us a free Creme de Leche cake for my bf's birthday. She recommended checking out other locally owned spots Wally's and Grassroots which we definitely will! Very open and a great wine/beer/cocktail selection. Not many know about their brunch they offer but Erica said dinner is busiest so maybe call for reservations. Will definitely be back, thanks Twisted Grove!

DN5NDcxqRKukj60xGLz8Jg.text: Brussels are amazing! The spinach and bacon salad was amazing and the burger and fries were amazing! So...pretty much amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TFssma2oag9hhZDB_n-QYQ.text: A group of ten humans walks into a bar...  We were all hungry and heard tale of Arizona Restaurant Week.  We were resting on our laurels from last year and decided to crush unbelievably large portion sizes and exercise extreme gluttony.  I'm glad we chose Twisted Grove.  My only negative quip was the service.  You could tell it was a bit unorganized, but they eventually ironed everything out and finished strong.  Mealtime:   C1 - We started with the Brussels.  Roasted and tossed in a balsamic reduction, served with sugar cured bacon and an elegant plating that probably makes the staff nervous.  Perfecto.  C2 - The prime.  A succulent steak served with a horseradish aioli and mashed potatoes.  I'm an Idaho boy, so I love me some mashers.  This entree was melt in your mouth hole certified.  C3 - Pecannnnnnn pie.  What a nice treat.  I was 4 cocktails deep and started forgetting things, but did I mention they made a hell of an Old Fashioned?  I'll be back, you can count on it.

ug0mwLl3Y0OvU2z7R-QrCQ.text: Attended a "private" event in their boardroom - included apps, drinks and a selection of an entree from fixed menu. Everything was delicious, will def be back to try their other items but my fav from what had was the avocado bruschetta, the mushroom flatbread and for the entree the wild mushroom pappardelle was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom pappardelle

opDpmMrqO4FOpc_Zbzqejg.text: This is one of our favorite places to go out and eat. The Brussels sprouts appetizer is fabulous. The bar staff have creative cocktails. The blueberry cobbler is out of this world, wish it was on the menu all the time. Several choices for entree, hard to decide what to get.

z-QjWeLkPDvS-RC85mrE-g.text: Packed at 7. Maybe because is spring training. They seemed overwhelmed. Seated about 10 minutes after reservation.   Sausage and onion flatbread was excellent and priced right.  The short rib was very tender and a good portion.  Pecan pie was interesting because of the custard bottom. Not my style. The tres leches was huge.  Service was inconsistent.   I will come back.

via9rLMi8JNN37JZXE0C8A.text: Stopped by for a quick lunch and had a seat at the bar. Delicious salad and my bartender Miranda was a great!

oy6cfWsncbm164-ICCjN-Q.text: Got good reviews on Yelp, so we decided to give a try.  Good parking available on a Tuesday evening.  Got seated immediately with no reservation.  Both indoor and outdoor seating available.  Nice craft beer selection, although few local to Phoenix/Scottsdale area.  My wife ordered the crab cakes and I went with short rib gnochi.  Both were very good, crab cakes could have been seared a bit more to give a crispier outer layer, but the roasted cauliflower with tahini side was best she ever tasted.  Creamed spinach side also very good.  The short rib gnochi was fabulous with plenty of meat and a balanced amount of pasta with a great dark sauce and a variety of veggie and spice bits mixed in.  Had the caramel pecan pie which was good but not as wonderful as the name implied.  Overall a very nice dining experience and I would recommend it.

k0xs-HGieAUCEq9Yd9Kv4A.text: We are big fans of Twisted Root's sister restaurant Grassroots. The food, particularly the oysters, were very good but the interior seating was very noisy. Our server, Mathew, did an awesome job.

eR8-NZhtbmXCH3Kmn4ZWHA.text: Great food, service and atmosphere. First time in but will head back for sure!

7FCNT_IYr5XtvaDpnPiiVw.text: Food was very good. Waitresses were really sweet. Three things make us give it only 3 stars: the food was only room temp when it got to the table, they turned off the misters though it was warmer than when we arrived, and it was ridiculously loud as the music volume was way high.  The table next to us complained, too, but the waitress said the owner doesn't allow for any adjustments.  Won't be back. Too many places with good food in Scottsdale.

ksPRkbexUbI-RHff6hrX5w.text: I can't say enough good things about this amazing restaurant, its owner and staff.  We've been in several times and are never disappointed.  In fact, we like it so much we decided to have our rehearsal dinner here so we could share it with our friends and family.  The food, drinks and service were outstanding.  Thank you so much Twisted Grove, for going all out for our special occasion.

q9pY6tVlN548lUh0s2B_Ug.text: The food was delicious, brussel sprouts a must! Our waiter (Tony) was awesome, and hilarious, he made our experience go from 4 stars to 5 stars.

QOZh_vGYU7IaP61OP3tGgw.text: They were not able to accommodate a group of 5 inside at a table with chairs. We had an elderly woman in our party that could not sit in a booth. Recommend calling ahead.

v04_mpJpXo1bG_Bt1BPHkQ.text: I've been here three times and this place hands down has excellent service, delicious food, and a nice modern atmosphere. We had mimosas with our lunch today and did I mention it was with freshly squeezed orange juice??? Doesn't get better than this and will come back again soon.

J6EPo8uN3DetgKrb9ovmcg.text: Wow, let's just talk about Twisted Grove for a moment. This is easily the best restaurant in the entire Scottsdale area. What makes it so great you ask? Impeccable service down to the tiniest detail, incredible food that makes you salivate at every bite, and an intense atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. Each and everyone of my needs were met, and one of the bussers (Peter) was very accommodating to my several tedious requests. Definitely get the Mushroom and Bourssin Flatbread, so good. Also, make sure you inquire about desserts - as they were fantastic. Just woah, I am utterly speechless.

LqzVg-Xj--PqtPFbc0BCxg.text: This is a charming and fresh feeling place with their act together. This is the best restaurant we have discovered in ages, and that says something in a resort town! The crab cakes, sunny salad and fish sandwich were special, as were the cookies and milk for dessert;) We were in on Mother's Day and all had truly delicious meals. Even the kids were wide-eyed with thumbs up! Our server, Emily, was amazing, attentive, and made our time a delight! We will be back again and again to a new favorite!

CNpbOi3sotaEe3eZa4nWEQ.text: Found this by accident and sure glad we did!  We wanted to go to an area that we wouldn't have a problem parking and this was it.  Charming restaurant.  We used to go to this location when it was a great BBQ place; but now it is totally changed.  Some yelpers complained about the price.  I thought it was pretty right for 2016!  Portions were just fine.  I liked that they had two sizes of salads and that they were also delish!  Last time I had a flat bread with mixed cheeses and a variety of sauteed mushrooms.  It was so big, I brought half home and actually ate it the next day!  I usually don't eat left overs and end up throwing them out.  Not this time.  As far as service, they are weak with their hostess or host.  however; we had Maya, and she was nice, adorable and a good attentive server.  For a lite lunch or lite dinner, I think in it's category of casual restaurants, it is excellent and would not hesitate to recommend it! I almost forgot to mention that their parmesan fries are fresh, crispy and excellent!  They came with my husband's club sandwich, which might have been the best one he's ever eaten!  I agree.  It just worked!

n9vDqb4H7_j3S0fr-t7PFg.text: Their new Brunch is wonderful.  I went with my family, 7 of us and we shared everything since all the food was so good and refreshingly creative.  We also recommend the Champagne and Bloody Mary Bar and we tried another drink that tasted like an Orange Julius.

5wim54KbobDf0BYW13L3qg.text: Have been here three times and am impressed with the service and food quality. The grouper sandwich is really good and the cheese fries are tasty.my wife had the crab cakes and was well pleased. You won't be disappointed with this resturant. DonF

IeMZ7UN90oi0cPIqblb0aQ.text: Happened to come across this new restaurant. I got there around 130pm and was shown to a table right away. The service was excellent.   I had an absolutely wonderful salad with noodles, avocado, mango, shrimp, and more. It was very unusual and I could have eaten a double-bowl of it!  My only complaint is that they don't have a website. I asked for and was given a card, but both the website and the phone number on it were not good. I know they just opened so I won't hold that against them, but they need to have an accurate Internet presence pretty soon. I eat lunch with several other people and was dying to show them the menu, but it's nowhere on-line ... yet.   I will definitely go to this restaurant again.

ORiOVL3FrCW0gKhRc7hauQ.text: Food was excellent. We had the oysters, bruschetta & brussel sprouts for appetizers. The bruschetta was my favorite. I hate pork chops & it was very good, my dad got that. My mom got the steak, she loved it. Our friend got the wild mushroom pappardelle & added chicken. He liked it but had to add a little salt. I got the cavetelli carbonara it was excellent but not served hot enough. All the sides we got were excellent but not served hot enough. We got the Ridge Three Valleys bottle of wine. It was excellent. The service was 5 star. Our server explained everything very well and she was very friendly.

k7SkZjJ6UelWWzjtHG7M-Q.text: Loved this place!  Our server was excellent & the food was amazing. They had Sunbru on tap which made my husband very happy. We had the spaghetti squash side to start. I'm still trying to figure out how to replicate this at home. It was fantastic. My hubby ordered the beef short ribs with gnocchi & I got the rotisserie chicken with cauliflower grits. Both entrees were delicious. Highly recommend.

LUwgDPsT8dIrKX10-j1oOw.text: I have been to Twisted Grove 4 times in the last month. First stopped in looking for a place to have a near future Birthday Happy Hour (3-6) at. Was hoping it would be good and I was not disappointed! My bartender Joseph was super welcoming and knowledgeable with the drink menu. I had given wine up for Lent and was looking for a beer comparable to Kiltlifter. He knew exactly which beer to suggest for me (Abita amber) and it was yummy and ice cold. I had the Tri-tip sliders off the Happy Hour menu. The meat was shaved thin and melted in your mouth. Awesome on the toasted pretzel roll. After a few beers, I also sampled the zucchini chips. Thin, crispy and like a certain potato chip, you can't eat just one. I decided right then that my Birthday party would be here. I texted everyone as I sipped my last beer. On my 2nd recon visit (gotta try some other items to recommend to my friends-don't I?) Reggie took good care of me. I had the Bruschetta and so should you. It is hands down the best I have ever eaten. You get to pick 3 from the selection of 5. I had the ricotta with cherry jam, the one with burrata, candied bacon and crispy onion strings and for the third it was goat cheese, dates, candied walnuts and a little honey. The bread they use is absolutely perfect for bruschetta. Nice crust on the outside and soft on the inside. All the ingredients were fresh and flavorful. Could not leave without trying the charred Brussels sprouts. OMG! Charring them brings out such depth.  Pairing it with a few bits of candied bacon is brilliant and then you get a little tang from the balsamic reduction. It just makes your mouth say "Wow, more please!". Now it's Birthday Happy Hour time! Got there right at 3 with my designated driver. By 4, we had about 10 people. Our waiter Tony was absolutely amazing! Separate checks was not a problem at all for him. Never once saw him write anything down. Had it all perfect. Since some people had arrived sooner than others we were all of different time schedules as far as who was ordering food and who needed another drink. Tony never missed a beat and we never went thirsty or hungry! Thanks, Tony! Everybody loved everything. Lent being over I was able to sample the wine menu. Love the Roth Cabernet. Tried a different bruschetta this time. Sounded a little strange since I had never seen anything like it. Avocado, pickled onion, cilantro and jalapeno? Not a fan of raw onions but I love me some Mexican flavors so why not try it? Another OMG! The creaminess of the avocado with the cilantro and the bite of the jalapeno on the toasted bread was outstanding. I even very much liked the thin pickled onion. Who knew? We tried some other items off the regular menu (salads, pepper glazed goat cheese, parmesan-garlic frittes, hot coco, tres leches cake) and they were all great.  The last time I was there it was more beer and bruschetta. This time 2 avocado ones and 1 burrata and candied bacon. More excellent service. Thanks, Kimmy for your special help. Actually starting to get a little hungry now. Been thinking about trying the sausage and onion flatbread for a while now. Cocktail hour is not too far away...... and from where I live neither is The Twisted Grove! Think I'm going to finish my chores and head on over.

wDS2lAubuC5Hva-Vqr_UbA.text: All I can say is YUM!  Some friends and I met here for Happy Hour before a concert and it was amazing.  None of us could decide what to order so we got a bunch of appetizers off the HH menu and a large salad.  Delish!  It was also extremely reasonable.  It's been sad watching restaurant after restaurant fail in this space so really hope this one takes.  The ambiance and food are perfect so hope it's a home run for them. I know I'll be going back as much as possible.

vj99VZkx7qh4WtLMsk6ePA.text: Visited the area last week, stayed at the Hyatt down the block.  Ended up eating here three straight nights it was so good.  The food and drinks are reasonably priced, the service is exceptional, and everything tastes incredible.  I literally ordered the gnocci/short ribs dish every night because it was so delicious.  The food was consistent and they put up with my 2 year old daughter jumping around in the booth and throwing sugar packets all over the place.  Wish this place had a sister restaurant in the DC area.  I'd be there all the time.

WXkwYoFB9IkZruV0qlDJwQ.text: Funky, fun, and great ambience! Love this eclectic place...great vibes and amazing food and drinks.

MhAebihwMfxzz3xbZED1xA.text: The bloody Mary I had was spectacular!! We also loved the roasted brussel sprouts appetizer!!  The sandwiches were good, but I thought they would have more umph based on the drinks and appetizer.

xZlXBGcMY4LzSDC83WMxMQ.text: Amazing food, drinks and service. Insane happy hour!!!Excellent kids menu options and kids eat free during certain hours. We had the Brussels sprouts app, short rib gnocchi, and crab cakes. The fleur de lis drink was wonderful. Butterscotch pecan pie for dessert was divine. We will most definitely be back!

nSUA65PqLkIcTudZRM7w6Q.text: The artichokes. Oh the artichokes. So flavorful. I didn't even know it was possible to have a flavorful artichoke. The menu and food quality really makes this a stand out choice. French onion soup with great depth of flavor. The place was busy and loud. It's got high ceilings and is open so noise caries. I would definitely come back.

vr4n_PIKHF_YIJGG1f0eew.text: Food is actually really good. Atmosphere is cool and we have liked everything we have gotten. The picnic chicken on happy hour menu is phenomenal. Incredibly flavorful sauce and soooo yummy.  Also the prime rib sliders are fantastic. We had a few tasty cocktails as well. It's on the higher side of prices for what it is but the ingredients are quality and presented well so I guess it's worth it.

bZenxjWGVsRbvpZD6A-kQg.text: On February 1, 2018 we took 2 out of town guests to Twisted Grove on a weeknight.  We enjoyed our dinner for 3, which included the night's special - a delicious sea bass in cream sauce, the house roasted salmon, and a burger.  Unfortunately, the 2 diners who ordered the fish entrees were violently ill after midnight, and throughout the entire night.  We can only surmise that food poisoning was the cause.  I reached out to the restaurant the very next morning, spoke to a bartender and the day manager, with no concern or formal response.

izKPc-86h3XsD3l3enR-3g.text: We've visited Twisted Grove a few times and found that consistently the drinks are good, bar service just adequate and food just good. Something that is also consistent is that we never are told about any off menu items.  Parties around us are told about these off menu items however for some reason we are never made aware of these tasty dishes.  Not sure what qualifies a party to be appraised of specials but I guess we don't rank.  Once or twice this can be overlooked but tonight several groups around us were made aware of specials but we were not.

_00n6d6a7Jflp91il2VSVA.text: This was amazing!! My BF and I shared the brussel sprouts that are so  highly recommended on yelp. They where just as good as we hoped. I had the gnocchi with short ribs. Some of the best food I've ever had. The gnocchi seemed to be lightly pan toasted which was awesome and the sauce didn't feel overly heavy. Only area of improvement would be that the food was slightly too salty - but that's personal preference.

Z5i1-mGFYKs3mKTuRUKveg.text: Absolutely loved the cauliflower with tahini side dish in fact I ordered a second batch it was so good! My friends short ribs were amazing! Best of all the welcoming and laid-back atmosphere.

OhcqhSpRBGrOxdX1VNIYbA.text: Love this place. Food is awesome. Very decadent, clean, hip, and not to expensive.

7xgRIKdsKazm6GfRmeTDeg.text: Twisted Grove has hosted an Annual dinner for the last 4 years, and every year the food & service get better and better.  I highly recommend leaving a big group event to their professional staff.  Their daily menu is just as amazing as their catering one.

pDmLep_OU0JZqknYGQb8ag.text: The service was good but the happy hour food was disappointing. It left a lot to be desired.

T7qlqKxe30f2Wzz7t68nSg.text: This place has phenomenal food. We went here for a date night and couldn't decide on the appetizers menu so we chose two! We ordered the roasted Brussels sprouts and the Bruschetta. Both were outstanding! The sprouts were cooked perfectly with bits of candied bacon and balsamic drizzled on each bite. They have many bruschetta options, you can choose three. The flavors were sweet and savory, and the bread was fresh and delicious underneath the toppings. For the main course we shared a delicious order of gnocchi and short ribs, in a rich creamy sauce. For dessert we shared a chocolate cheese cake, which we couldn't finish because we were so full from all of the food. Great date night, great food, great service!

Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate cheese cake
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi and short ribs

av98TJYR90Nkxj_8VJ3-fQ.text: Came here for a super late lunch. At first looking at the menu I was skeptical because I'm not that familiar with this type of food.   Ended up ordering the bruschetta board - prosciutto, avocado, and candied bacon as my three choices. The avocado bruschetta was wonderful! I definitely would order that again.   Definitely coming back to try something else in the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bruschetta board - prosciutto, candied bacon, avocado.  Chicken bacon sandwich

KY6XOOIiBVE3Iy25j_aVkQ.text: Went there last night for a office happy hour.  Ordered a ginger beer. Pretty simple. Start with a clean glass, add ice and add ginger beer. Twice I was served a ginger beer with something colorful in it. First glass had something red. Second glass had something orange. We made fun of how it appeared to be crawling, hopefully from the carbonation. But, if a drink is sent back because the customer saw something it it try to make sure the second one is clean. Just sayin!

uQ1mWbBmXiK2qT3QQ6FWhQ.text: Disappointed! This used to be my favorite Scottsdale restaurant. We had dinner there tonight and were rushed through. Waiter asked about dessert and brought the check before we were even done eating. Was t even busy. Probably would have ordered the dessert on special but we weren't even done eating. With all the choices around town will nothing back.

-iT4Jrjhn3Z_-xtFu2yLHQ.text: We really like this place! Enjoy lunch with the great menu with some great food! I really like the brunch on the weekends! The Eggs in purgatory are amazing! Last weekend I had the Beef short rib hash,it was awesome. I love the bread you serve with everything. We really enjoy the flatbread also! We'll be back again!

0YHr5ZhU2W2i6qaycKuGVA.text: LOVE this place. Wow, I don't have 1 bad thing to say about it. Great service, great drinks, and awesome food. We came during happy hour on a Monday and sat on the patio.   We got cocktails, the bruschetta board & the crispy fish tacos. For the bruschetta board, we got the burrata, avocado & goat cheese. Our favorite was definitely the avocado bruschetta, it was bursting with flavor and extremely tasty. Each piece of bruschetta is cut into 3 large pieces, so you're getting a lot out of each kind. The bread was toasted perfectly and was crispy & soft at the same time. Perfectly done.   Really looking forward to returning here for dinner in the future, it's a great new addition to the Scottsdale dining scene!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fantastic bruschetta board during happy hour. We got the Goat Cheese, Avocado &amp; Burrata (left to right). They were all delicious

9wJkiIWenUA06fkemEzQZQ.text: The chicken with mash potatoes is wonderful as the contrast with the stuffing makes for a hearty meal. My wife had the French dip and is somewhat of an expert when it comes to these sandwiches, she gave the dip a B+.

PkgSgHB8l1ZKlQh0t9DdCA.text: Great food,  good atmosphere.  I'll start with the atmosphere. Inside is very loud and lively, we chose to sit outside because we weren't feeling the loudness that particular evening. BTW, the restaurants interior is very well put together. Patio has misters and shade screens to block the sun. It was hot (what you would expect summer to feel like) but with the shade and misters it made the patio feel nice and comfortable, but probably to hot for some, you know who you are.  The food looked and smelled fantastic. We were not in the mood for meat that evening so we ordered all vegetarian dishes. They had enough to feed a table of four. Needless to say, everything we ordered was delicious which made us not even miss the meat.  I would definitely go back with my significant other or as a group. The atmosphere seemed fun and a good place to have some drinks with your mates. I would give it five stars but I've only been there once and I think it takes a few times to really know a place, so who knows, maybe next time my rating will change.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

efVs_qLXAQ5RVpB1aKnp2w.text: Spacious. Loved the hipsterish design. Ok service, bad music. Food was delicious. Bruschettas are good especially with prosciutto. We enjoyed sharing gnocchi with short ribs which melt in the mouth!  Spinach dip is a proper delicious dip bit greasy and creamy but you know what you ordering.. strawberry Bellini is just a perfect one so I am coming back for it and try their salad! Highly recommend!

Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mouth watering ribs
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The best Bellini ever

_05NuUnF6FWf9IZhItkTtg.text: This place is absolutely amazing. The short rib gnocchi dish is to die for. I get it every time. I love how spacious it is inside. The decor is really cute and gives it a special touch. Also, the service is great every time.   I went here on a first date with my now fiance and we would love to do our rehearsal dinner here next year!  This place will not disappoint you.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short Rib &amp; Ricotta Gnocchi - AMAZING!

DciMas_c6aHXL1J9ABFcRg.text: We wanted to try one of the sister restaurants to Macintosh. We were not disappointed.  The restaurant is beautiful and cozy. Austin our server was friendly and attentive. Our Arnold Palmers were never empty and our table was cleared with perfect timing. We started and split the Cobb Salad. Delicious!! I had the Stacked Eggplant Sandwich with fantastic garlic fries. I would go back for this sandwich! My husband had the Market Fish of the day. Blackened Swordfish with the most delicious kale. The Swordfish was perfect! When I'm the area we will be back!! Thanks Austin for a wonderful experience at Twisted Grove!!

dHESYj6LuUDrhZ1PEKxB3Q.text: Solid.  Friendly people.  Cocktails are good... but do I really have to say it?  A Sazerac does NOT come with an ice cube.  And why did the two I have taste different?    Oh well whatever, I'll be back.

7aOL944kVe6DVKI1wQ23Jw.text: Twisted Grove & Parlor Where have you been all my life ? My mother in law told me about this place and I wish I would have came sooner. We came for my Birthday celebration & I was not disappointed. The short rib & gnocchi is simply the best I think I've ever had anywhere , the only problem was there was not enough of it with my delicious short rib that was cooked to perfection! My husband had the French dip that looked delicious and my picky kids loved theirs so it's a win all around. Plus did I mention kids eat free from 2-6 as well as they have a great happy hour. The kids meal menu has a great selection and comes with a scoop of ice cream next door at the most adorable ice cream parlor with great service. I can't wait to try all the other places owned by the same family. I will be back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wonderful selection of kids menu.
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Who doesn&#39;t love Happy Hour
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short rib &amp; gnocchi !!! A must try.

9eypC6W_SKBQGDvToQC-OA.text: Traveling through Scottsdale on a Holiday weekend and we happened onto this place. We tried the prime rib sliders and a specialty pizza. Both dishes were good, the pizza was more memorable. Inside the place is really nice, upscale & they wait on you well. Inside a strip mall, but isolated it's cool place. They have plenty of room & they keep the air conditioning cold. I wasn't blown away by anything but everything was good, from the food to the ambiance to the service, all in all I'd say they earn a pretty solid 4 star. It could cost you a few bucks to go here it isn't a cheap option. This place is nice enough for a date, but also good for families, a work luncheon, basically all of the above check them out if in Scottsdale. Happy eating

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prime rib sliders
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Angry bird flat bread

dw-wUjXH4bgsLR1i23CnkQ.text: Brandon did a wonderful job making my first time experience a five star. He was very attentive and friendly from start to finish. He recommended drinks since it was my first time here. Was very patient when we were trying to make a decision on our food order. The atmosphere is very fun and the food was delicious. I got the salmon poke as an appetizer and for my entree i ordered the prime rib and Caprese to share. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon poke

09-STBZSLZpitHzkKMZ4GQ.text: This place is definitely worth the visit! Tried their shishito peppers, charred brussel sprouts and short rib with ricotta gnocchi! The brussel sprouts were my least favorite. The cook went to town on making sure they were charred super well!! Too charred for my taste, sorry!!!  On the flip side, the short rib with ricotta gnocchi was an absolute hit! The short rib was nicely tender & had an abundance of flavor. It was just slightly salty, but the flavor in each bite took me to another dimension that I soon forgot any bit of saltiness. The gnocchi had just the right touch of soft doughy chewiness and was an excellent complement to the short rib!  The oreo cookie cheesecake and chocolate mousse cake was the perfect ending to a fabulous meal. Wish I took some pics, but when the cakes came out, we all had our forks ready and there was no stopping us!   We were there for a friend's bday and our waiter was kind enough to comp the cheesecake for us! Thank you for a lovely dinner; I'll be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Short rib ricotta gnocchi!
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charred brussel sprouts!!

5-D8FFjqTjYGU4PEhS32Nw.text: Someone once said if you cannot afford to tip, you cannot afford to go out and eat. Apparently, I'm the biggest fan of tipping at this spot. Literally, if you look up the tips for this place, you will see my happy mug there. But you get the gist of tipping that I am referencing. Twisted Grove is a perfect brunch choice or in most cases, my fave place for lunch meetings. How have I not gushed about you??  Staff is always friendly despite its bustle of regular patrons, myself included. I used to come at least three times a week when I lived in the area, but good thing my office is close and this is my go-to for client entertaining. The front entry is cheerful and you can be a do-gooder and donate a book. You're welcome to snag a good one too.  I prefer to snag a seat at the bar and chat up with the staff. Where should I begin on what you should choose? It would end up being longer than some trilogy. I am a big fan of appetizers and the presentation of the charred brussels sprouts is in itself so inviting. Bits of bacon can be pretty persuasive. I will admit I am a creature of habit because I am in love with the Caesar salad with grilled steak and open egg, no dressing. Trust me, you'll thank me for your gains. If somehow, I managed to venture differently, the sunny cobb is bound to make your belly happy. The unexpected sweet fried onions and moist chicken make this salad an entree. Another top candidate is the cowboy style two potato hash. I want to wake up to the world every day if I could devour this for breakfast daily. If it is on menu and in season, order the crab/lobster Mac'n'cheese because who wouldn't? Weekends are popular here, as well as the holidays when pie orders go in. Plan early for a pumpkin or pecan pie for sure.  Last but not least, always first on my list, their starlight is the dessert menu. If it's on the menu, I have probably had it three to four times to be exact. I am unwilling to share the Tres Leches and pretty much will break the golden rule of sharing. There are simply no words to describe this uhmazing piece of heaven, other than my pictures. Try it and you will understand. That creaminess and milky goodness is not to be found elsewhere. I certainly believe the fresh berries somehow deflect the calories. Again, have you not seen the pictures? Anyone can be the type that works out and loves dessert. Never ever skip dessert.   I will return for brunch, lunch, dinner, you name it and I'm going to be eating here. A very happy face makes for a very happy belly. All I can say is, I stinkin adore you Twisted Grove. You have my heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I could give up dessert but I&#39;m not a quitter. No one gives away this tres leches cake!
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My idea of fish fry Friday. Morsels of lobster goodness.
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Today&#39;s special- lobster roll with Parmesan cheese fries. It&#39;s a wonderful little arrangement of delish atoms!

sYIUnl2MFmbcQWehZP3W5w.text: Great place for Happy Hour. Patio is super nice! I met up with a friend and we had a blast! The bruschetta is some of the best in the area, that I have had. I also enjoyed the Poke too! We came towards the end of Happy Hour and were seated. Drinks were yummy, and very balanced, not too strong, but you could taste the alcohol. Excited to venture back and try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ip_mwqKMEldmFVMXxBzuWA.text: We had a private party of 20 in the back room. Management worked with us to develop a special menu to meet our price point.  Service was amazing, and the food was delicious.  I had a Caesar salad and French dip with fries.  The roast beef was sliced thin and piled high. Just the right hint of horseradish, and the au jus was perfect.  Fries nice and crispy.    We ordered dessert - I shared the tres leches cake and the butterscotch pecan pie. Both were amazing- one was light and fluffy, the other dense and delicious.    You must try there Rose 76 beverage.  Bombay, sparkling Rose - a perfect refresher.    Really happy!  I will be back, and I live 65 miles away!

KGiF20lV956gULx_WaYi7A.text: Stellar!!! All around!! Went with friends for a double date night. Second time here. It's so good!  Atmosphere: Very comfortable. Casual and kind of hip. Social, spacious and a little loud, but not overly. Great layout, big bar, tables and booths all around.  Service: both times our service was great. Attentive and friendly. Knowledgeable and social. Okay, after the place closed and we were still there, it was tough to even get a water refill, but, we had been there for several hours. And, it was very odd that on a Saturday night this place closed at 10pm. Pretty early. Once the staff was cleaning, they were on a mission to get out of there. No points off for this, just odd.  Food: here's where they really shine. They have a great selection of drinks!! Tons of choices and all of them seem like they're made with the highest quality fresh ingredients and really inventive, unique blends. We tried several and all were stellar! Then the food; wide selection including appetizers. We lived the apps so much we actually ordered a second round of them! The roasted Brussels sprouts with thick cut maple bacon were unreal!! The second order hit the spot!! The guys both ordered the short ribs and house made gnocchi, unbelievable!! So rich and thick, tender and delicious!! The girls both ordered the soba noodle salad, one shrimp and one chicken. Super fresh, perfectly cooked and spiced. All the meals were plentiful and made with care and fresh ingredients. Food is a good value at just over $15 per person and great drinks are about $10 each.  Overall this place is great! It's a bit odd that they own the restaurant next door and I didn't like it at all. But Twisted Grove is excellent. I recommend it and look forward to a third visit, worth the drive in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted Brussels Sprouts, thick cut bacon on the side served on a plank. &#34;Spilling&#34; out of a tipped over mason jar. Delicious!
Photo of Twisted Grove Parlor + Bar - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Very comfortable, spacious, warm, homey, loud, but not too loud.

s1CLbWitQ3LxdNBtAMlkrQ.text: This has been my favorite place to eat for years! I can honestly say I throughly enjoy everything on the menu.  However, as of late, the fruit flies have been a bit much. I mean as soon as my drink and food is set down they're swarming. No one wants to eat with constantly having to swat in every direction.   So either 1)the trash isn't being taken out enough or 2)some food somewhere isn't being properly stored. What a shame

9lmhd1sq7qWXZRTPA9sSgg.text: Delicious food with housemade pasta. Interesting drinks but some with too many ingredients that muddy the flavors a bit. Will definitely come back!

XyR-UIJagJ4EDsHB2YQHBQ.text: I would say 4.5 stars. The food was very good and the drinks were spot on. Only thing was that I ordered a pasta with lobster and they were out of lobster. Has a nice patio to enjoy and the bar area looked enjoyable. Would definitely go again

43wWC6XlT-zmqfi36OrBBQ.text: For a group of 12, we were able to make a reservation about 30 minutes ahead of time and were still easily accommodated. My only gripe was that the special of the day was described as swordfish with green beans and instead I received swordfish with a cold beet and goat cheese side with crushed cashews and balsamic which I didn't find appetizing, and for $35 it was a bit disappointing they didn't share the market price with me or serve what was described.    Apparently the artichokes were a huge hit! We will still be back!
